website_summaries.verdict: While this respirator mask is a top choice for shoppers on a budget, several competitors offer better construction.
pros: A must-have for anyone who frequently works closely with metallic fumes, paint spray, or small dust particles
cons: A few consumers gripe about the flimsy plastic straps and components, which tend to break over time

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made already broken
customer_reviews.text: Plastic headstrap is about half the thickness of the one I bought 7 years before, used daily and still works. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS CHEAP STUFF. Also got a filter from them that was actually thinner than typical--called 3M, and they said send them some pics. Did so, and never heard from them. I don't think this is a serious company anymore. Not with stuff going on like this. If you're a professional, find another supplier.
customer_reviews.author: T. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Used respirator, how great is that?
customer_reviews.text: Unable to use this respirator as it is used. The package was wide open, the rubber that would act as the gasket on your face has scuffs marks all over it, and little cuts in it. Beware. So disappointed right now. I'm not even returning it, I'm throwing it away, so it isn't passed off to someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Super value respirator that performs above expectations
customer_reviews.text: Remodelling some condo's recently and was getting bothered using disposable paper nose filters. My protective eyewear kept getting foggy and breathing was becoming a bother. Got this 3M Respirator and it's a welcome addtion to my tool bag. The LARGE size fits me perfect and I would regard my head a medium. If your 6 Ft tall or have a large head look for Extra Large. Sealing is excellent and provides normal breathing motion. Working with drywall dust the whole day using this 3M product is not a concern. The straps are designed with comfort and stay comfortably in place. Proper filter (for dusty conditions) to purchase is the 3M 2091 P100 Particulate Filter.
customer_reviews.author: Rott boy

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I bought a large version of the product and everything fit perfectly. I hardly had to adjust the straps. Very comfortable, a bargain price, overall a great product. Only issue i had was the fact that I doesn't come with a set of filters but that's perfectly acceptable. No more breathing in Caustic or Acidic chemical particulates for me!!
customer_reviews.author: Dancing Hands Drew

customer_reviews.title: I have a beard and this still works.
customer_reviews.text: I have a beard and this still works great. Easy to put on and take off.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Three years and still going strong -- remember to replace the filter cartridges!
customer_reviews.text: This respirator is excellent. It fits a medium woman's head, a large woman's head, and a medium dude's head just fine. You'll want to make sure you have a good seal, just like any other respirator, but it's comfortable to use for long periods of time thanks to the weight distribution of the straps.
customer_reviews.author: SJ and SF

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with filters.

customer_reviews.title: Smells chemical
customer_reviews.text: It works, only sometimes hard to get good seal around nose. It has very awful chemical smell I got headache when using it for long time. But I think the smell has weakened over time. It is made from plastic the straps and everything as everything now days, the seal around face seems silicone. I bought the 60926 filters to use with it and easy to breathe. Update: good the chemical smell has stopped now after many months. Update: Added more pictures. The straps have disintegrated in about a year only in infrequent diy use. So that's pretty awful.
customer_reviews.author: Perinne

customer_reviews.title: super great value - love it
customer_reviews.text: Super great value with the right filters. Strange head strap but it works. Buy it if you need it. I am using it with: 3M 50051138541861 Multi Gas/Vapor Cartridge 6006 501 FILTER RETAINER with the 3M 5P71PB1 6000 Series Particulate Filter P95 I can not smell the fiberglass resin or the strong nasty smelling epoxy that was making me dizzy. With the 6000 series Particulate filters I can also use it for sanding and grinding. Equipped with the filter setup described above it is a fantastic economic "do it all" filter/mask setup.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Robert

customer_reviews.title: didn't come with filters! USELESS!

customer_reviews.title: Requires expensive filters which are not included.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and does the job for a great price

Nothing terrible but some moisture would come out of the bottom and fog up the bottom of my glasses (or goggles). Not sure there's a way that can be avoided though or that any other mask would have done a better job.

customer_reviews.title: Protection against oil base paint fumes

Ordered it and a couple of days later I was able to complete the entire length of the fence with no odors penetrating through the mask.

customer_reviews.title: Made me re-evaluate my life

I hadn't breathed that well in years. I started using it while watching TV because the air was so clean. Then I started to wonder why. Turned out we had a really bad mold infestation in the walls and standing water under the floor. Had to rip out most of the basement and refinish it. Now, I have no problem breathing downstairs, and I'm coughing a lot less. All because I bought this little mask!

customer_reviews.title: Very good mask. I have the MSA safety brand also
customer_reviews.text: Very good mask. I have the MSA safety brand also, and this is almost identical. And no, MSA safety and 3M cartridges are NOT compatible. (I tried) They both have the 1/4 turn connection, but 3M is much smaller. However, I could buy the same 3M cartridges AND facepeice for less than just the MSA cartridges... so, that's what I did. Good mask. Clean it after use, and it lasts for a long time.

product_meta.title: 3M Half Facepiece Reusable Respirator 6300, Gases, Vapors, Dust, Paint, Cleaning, Grinding, Sawing, Sanding, Welding, Large
product_meta.description: The 3M Half Facepiece Reusable Respirator 6000 Series helps provide protection against particulates and a wide variety of gases and vapors when used with approved cartridges and filters. When properly fitted and used with approved 3M cartridges and filters, this respirator can help provide protection at concentrations up to 10 times the Permissible Exposure Limit (PEL). The swept back design of the cartridges helps improve balance and visibility. Remarkably comfortable, soft, lightweight facepiece has easy-to-adjust head straps that allow for a customized fit to the user. Replaceable cartridges help reduce waste and costs over time. NIOSH, a Federal government regulatory agency, has tested and approved the 6000 Series Half Facepiece with certain 3M cartridges, filters and supplied air systems. The 6000 Series is NIOSH approved for negative-pressure air purifying and positive-pressure dual airline applications. This half facepiece respirator may be used with 3M Cartridge 6000 Series; 3M Filters 2000, 2200, 7000 or 5000 Series; or 3M Dual Airline Systems against a variety of gases, vapors, and particulate hazards according to NIOSH approvals. Some applications include: assembly and mechanical, chemical clean-up, chemical handling, chipping, chiseling, cleaning, furnace operations, grinding, laboratories, machining, masonry, painting, pouring/casting, sanding, sawing, welding, construction, general manufacturing, industrial maintenance, mining, etc. Breathing hazardous particles, gases and vapors can be harmful to your health. The 3M Half Facepiece Reusable Respirator 6000 Series helps reduce exposure to many contaminants. Warning: Respirators help protect against certain airborne contaminants. Before use, the wearer must read and understand the User Instructions provided as a part of the product packaging. Follow all local regulations. In the U.S., a written respiratory protection program must be implemented meeting all the requirements of OSHA 29 CFR 1910.134 including training, fit testing and medical evaluation. In Canada, CSA standards Z94.4 requirements must be met and/or requirements of the applicable jurisdiction, as appropriate. Misuse may result in sickness or death. For correct use, consult supervisor and User Instructions, or call 3M Personal Safety Division (PSD) Technical Service in the U.S.A. at 1-800-243-4630. In Canada, call 1-800-267-4414. Disclaimer: 3M industrial and occupational products are intended, labeled, and packaged for sale to trained industrial and occupational customers for workplace use. Unless specifically stated otherwise on the applicable product packaging or literature, these products are not intended, labeled, or packaged for sale to or use by consumers (e.g., for home, personal, primary or secondary school, recreational/sporting, or other uses not described in the applicable product packaging or literature), and must be selected and used in compliance with applicable health and safety regulations and standards (e.g., U.S. OSHA, ANSI), as well as all product literature, user instructions, warnings, and limitations. Misuse of 3M industrial and occupational products may result in injury, sickness, or death. For help with product selection and use, consult your on-site safety professional, industrial hygienist, or other subject matter expert.
